properties.name: Alarm Code
properties.description:
Alarm codes are defined by CPI as part of the Digital Membership Architecture for Medicines Manufacturing.  They describe the different failure conditions that can occur during medicines manufacturing process, their relative severity (or 'colour'), and the required recovery action.

Alarm codes have been consolidated from a number of sources, including equipment manufacturers.  It is envisaged that this list will continue to evolve as the requirements are better understood.

The full list of Digital Membership Alarm Codes is currently defined in the PLANT Domain reference data:
- https://github.com/mmic-collaboration/plant-domain-model/tree/development/reference-data

properties.name: Alarm Code
alarm code id
properties.description: The unique Digital Membership assigned identifier

properties.name: alarm code number
properties.description: a short description of the alarm code, typically displayed to the user via the ui of the control software

properties.name: alarm warning message
properties.description: a short description of the alarm code, typically displayed to the user via the ui of the control software

properties.name: alarm condition
properties.sample: Air Pressure switch PRS1035 indicating a Low Inlet Air Pressure
properties.description: the condition or conditions which resulted in this alarm

properties.name: alarm colour
properties.description:
A colour to indicate the severity of the triggered alarm, with the recovery action:
 - RED - Machine Stop, Clear fault condition and trigger reset/restart
 - YELLOW - Machine Paused, Remove hold condition, machine will resume automatic control.
 - WHITE - Information, n/a
 - BLUE - Low Materials Warning, Replenish material stock

Ref: FS01 Data Specification, CPI, martin.keane@cpi-uk.com

properties.name: alarm code  standard recovery action
properties.sample: Stop filling system, de-energise air dump valve
properties.description: a short description of the action required in response to this alarm

Alarm codes are defined by CPI as part of the Digital Membership Architecture for Medicines Manufacturing.  They describe the different failure conditions that can occur during medicines manufacturing process, their relative severity (or 'colour'), and the required recovery action.

Alarm codes have been consolidated from a number of sources, including equipment manufacturers.  It is envisaged that this list will continue to evolve as the requirements are better understood.

The full list of Digital Membership Alarm Codes is currently defined in the PLANT Domain reference data:
- https://github.com/mmic-collaboration/plant-domain-model/tree/development/reference-data

properties.name: acknowledged
properties.description:
Describes the state of an alarm.
ref: OPC-UA=10000-Part9 (v1.05.03)

properties.name: state
properties.description:
The station state captures the lifecycle of a station:

1. The transition from Available to Running occurs when a Station Start Request is received from either the local HMI or the Machine Level SCADA.
2. The transition from Running to In Cycle occurs when the machine is in the Running state and the machine is in auto mode.
3. The transition from In Cycle to Fault occurs when a red alarm becomes active.
4. The transition from Fault to In Cycle occurs when all red alarms have been cleared.

Ref: FS01 Data Specification, CPI, martin.keane@cpi-uk.com
